tweets.text:
We've just taken delivery of our biggest batch of electric vehicles to date - 25 electric vans to help us save over 300 tonnes of carbon emissions.

We'll replace all our diesel vans with electric in the next 5 years, helping us reach #netzero by 2030.

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/eyMQXNY55s

@gedbird @FyldeBeachCare @unitedutilities @LOVEmyBEACH_NW @LoveMyBeachMBP @KeepBritainTidy @_MBay @EnvAgency @ConnectRightUK @DouglasPilot @RibbleLife Ours are exactly like the ‚Äòincorrect‚Äô photo. Only the toilet waste goes into an enclosed pipe straight into the sewer waste. Bathroom & kitchen sinks, bath and washing machine go into the same downpipe as the gutters off the roof. Where it goes from there I don‚Äôt have a clue
@mca_debbie @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 @NewsNBC Hi Deb, we get it too and we‚Äôre a mile and a half away

@SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 lack of care highlighted yet again & just silence.Thousands in misery,health issues grow, public services & businesses suffer.Newcastle under Lyme & now parts of Stoke are just ‚Äòno go‚Äô stinking zones disgraceful & morally wrong,who will step up? #StopTheStink

@ciderboy10 @NewsNBC @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe üò≥ my pal in Penkhull has had the same for the last 3 nights, off the scale ü§Æit‚Äôs miles away...it‚Äôs completely unacceptable, so many health issues emerging... action must be taken tonight,  it‚Äôs out of control

@madcow42 @unitedutilities @EnvAgency Hi, unfortunately I think you're right and there isn't financial support available. However, if you want to take a look at https://t.co/Pd22MH3Jxz they have plenty more info and guidance.

urls.title: ERDF SUNRISE Project Partnership - Wildflowers, pollinators and birds to benefit from work to improve river habitats in Milton
urls.description: Posted on The River Trent is the third longest river in England, flowing for 185 miles. It starts its epic journey as a natural spring high up on Biddulph Moor, north of Stoke-on-Trent. As it travels through the city it is still in its infancy, and just a few feet wide in places. Nowhere is this more apparent than in Milton, in the north of the city. The diminutive channel here is easy to overlook, but it nevertheless still provides a great green corridor for connecting wildlife throughout the city. Under

urls.title: Waste Crime ‚Äì Be Part of the Solution
urls.description: Our Environmental Crime Officer, Stephanie Marriott, talks about the effects from waste crime that she sees every day and how you can help us in our fight against illegal waste activity.

tweets.text:
Stopping #WasteCrime helps to protect the environment and businesses too.

Our Environmental Crime Officer talks about the effects from waste crime that she sees every day in our latest blog.

Read it now: https://t.co/egpounEgVq https://t.co/e0Ek991NTn

Anyone managing waste outside the law is committing #WasteCrime.

We successfully seized this truck, believed to be involved in waste crime, in a joint operation with the police.

Help us continue our fight by completing the Waste Crime Survey üëá

https://t.co/S6bV2wnn2w https://t.co/qpp8Kf2bcV

@madcow42 @FyldeBeachCare @unitedutilities @LOVEmyBEACH_NW @LoveMyBeachMBP @KeepBritainTidy @_MBay @EnvAgency @ConnectRightUK @DouglasPilot @RibbleLife I used to live in a 1920‚Äôs house built with the rainwater going to soakaways, but with age these had failed with silt build-up and the downpipes from the rainwater gutters redirected into foul water gullies. Then with bathroom replacements easier to put wastes into downpipes üôÉ

Today I‚Äôm amplifying the voices of our fantastic female @EnvAgency operational leaders. They lead our response on the ground across the country at a local level working on our flood & regulation work. 

#ActOnTheGap #TogetherForOurPlanet #ChooseToChallenge https://t.co/P4qXVvCryB
Our Leicester field team have been busy removing a build-up of silt around bridge arches on the Sileby Brook to help increase channel capacity and reduce flood risk https://t.co/71TGqmF0PG

tweets.text:
Our officers are out checking that people aren‚Äôt #fishing during close season, 15 March-15 June, to protect spawning fish. 

We‚Äôre patrolling the river in the #Colne Valley and working with partners to protect Sites of Special Scientific Interest including Shortwood Common Ponds. https://t.co/lQPUg2HPOS

It‚Äôs illegal to coarse fish on rivers during close season from 15 March and 15 June. This is to protect spawning #fish. 

Our officers are patrolling across Hertfordshire and North London. 

You can report illegal activity on 0800 80 70 60. https://t.co/YF7uLgTgPE

@Thrafstira Weather loach aren‚Äôt native to the UK and you can‚Äôt release them in the wild. Any introduction would be an illegal offence under the Keeping and Introduction of Freshwater Fish legislation and Wildlife & Countryside Act. You could re-home them through aquatics/ornamental trade.
Really important piece of work - great to see it underway. https://t.co/KIXoROnpFo

High phosphate levels directly contribute to excessive bacteria growth in rivers which in plain English, slowly suffocates rivers and everything in them and no, I'm not kidding. https://t.co/uvq24jNc7P

urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. We‚Äôd like to set additional cookies to understand how you use GOV.UK, remember your settings and improve government services.
